page.title: 07The Washington Tomb Sulgrave
page.content: Inside the church the bodies of Lawrence and Amee Washington,ancestors of George Washington,the first President of the United States of America (1789),are buried under a slab of Hornton Stone.At the head is a brass showing the family arms,maybe the origin of the Stars and Stripes.Lower down is the headless brass of Lawrence wearing a doublet,a loose gown with sleeves edged with fur and broad-toed shoes,the costume of a well to do yeoman in Tudor times.Besides this is an empty space where the brass of Amee rested and below this are Â£the weepers',their children,four boys and seven girls.These two brasses were stolen in 1885 but were found and replaced in 1924.Many American tourists visit this memorial after they have been to the nearby Sulgrave Manor.
